resource_data:
<expression xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.imsglobal.org/xsd/imslorsltitm_v1p0 http://fire.eun.org/lode/imslorsltitm_v1p0.xsd" xmlns="http://www.imsglobal.org/xsd/imslorsltitm_v1p0" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance">
  <identifier>
    <catalog>hdl</catalog>
    <entry>10494/108412</entry>
  </identifier>
  <identifier>
    <catalog>expression-cmr-id</catalog>
    <entry>108412</entry>
  </identifier>
  <description>
    <facet>
      <vocabularyID>LRE.expressionDescriptionFacetValues</vocabularyID>
      <value>main</value>
    </facet>
    <metadata>
      <schema>http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM</schema>
      <lom xsi:schemaLocation="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/lomv1.0/lomLoose.xsd" xmlns="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM">
        <general>
          <identifier>
            <catalog>oercommons.org</catalog>
            <entry>1770204636</entry>
          </identifier>
          <title>
            <string language="en">Pilgrimage: Mission</string>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Pilgrimage: Mission</string>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">Pélerinage : Mission</string>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Pilgrimage: Missão</string>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Pilgrimage: Missione</string>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Προσκύνημα: Αποστολή</string>
            <string language="x-mt-es">Peregrinaje: Misión</string>
          </title>
          <description>
            <string language="en">The students view symbols and traditions of world religions in artwork as a source for discussion of the effect of "mission" in world history. This discussion also parallels texts usually taught in English II.</string>
          </description>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">Social Sciences</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">Humanities</string>
          </keyword>
          <language>en</language>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Die Kursteilnehmeransichtsymbole und die 
Traditionen der Weltreligionen in der Gestaltungsarbeit als Quelle 
für Diskussion über den Effekt "der Mission" in der Weltgeschichte. 
Diese Diskussion entspricht auch die Texte, die normalerweise in
englischem II unterrichtet werden.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">Les symboles de vue d'étudiants et les traditions
des religions du monde dans le dessin-modèle comme source pour la 
discussion de l'effet de la "mission" dans l'histoire du monde. 
Cette discussion met en parallèle également des textes 
habituellement enseignés dans II anglais.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Os símbolos da opinião dos estudantes e as 
tradições de religiões do mundo na arte -final como uma fonte para 
a discussão do efeito da "missão" no history do mundo. Esta 
discussão paraleliza também os textos ensinados geralmente em II 
inglês.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-it">I simboli di punto di vista degli allievi e le 
tradizioni delle religioni del mondo in illustrazione come sorgente 
per la discussione sull'effetto "della missione" nella storia del 
mondo. Questa discussione egualmente mette i testi in parallelo 
insegnati solitamente in II inglese.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Οι σπουδαστές εμφανίζουν τα σύμβολα και τις παραδόσεις
παγκόσμιων θρησκειών στο έργο τέχνης ως πηγή για τη συζήτηση της
επίδρασης "της αποστολήσ" στην παγκόσμια ιστορία. Αυτή η 
συζήτηση παραλληλίζει επίσης τα κείμενα που διδάσκονται συνήθως 
στα αγγλικά ΙΙ.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-es">Los símbolos de la opinión de los estudiantes y 
las tradiciones de las religiones del mundo en ilustraciones como 
fuente para la discusión del efecto de la "misión" en historia del 
mundo. Esta discusión también es paralelo a los textos 
enseñados generalmente en II inglés.</string>
          </description>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Sozialwissenschaften</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Menschlichkeit</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">Les Sciences Sociales</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">Sciences humaines</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Ciências Sociais</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Humanities</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Scienze Sociali</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Studi umanistici</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Κοινωνικές επιστήμες</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Ανθρωπότητες</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-es">Ciencias Sociales</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-es">Humanidad</string>
          </keyword>
        </general>
        <lifeCycle>
          <contribute>
            <role>
              <source>roleValues</source>
              <value>author</value>
            </role>
            <entity>BEGIN:VCARD

          </contribute>
        </lifeCycle>

          </identifier>
          <language>en</language>

              <value>provider</value>

VERSION:3.0

          </contribute>
        </metaMetadata>
        <educational>
          <language>en</language>
        </educational>
        <rights>
          <copyrightAndOtherRestrictions>
            <source>copyrightAndOtherRestrictionsValues</source>
            <value>yes</value>
          </copyrightAndOtherRestrictions>

            <string language="en">Creative Commons Attribution-Noncommercial-Share Alike 2.5</string>
          </description>
        </rights>
      </lom>
    </metadata>
  </description>
  <manifestation>
    <identifier>
      <catalog>manifestation-cmr-id</catalog>
      <entry>108412</entry>
